IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: COMBINED CHARITABLE CAMPAIGN THAT GIVES EMPLOYEES A DIRECT ROLE IN SELECTION OF GRANT RECIPIENTS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: ACECF EMPOWERS EMPLOYEES THROUGH PHILANTHROPY TO ENHANCE THE LIVES OF PEOPLE IN OUR COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.Description: THE ALTRIA COMPANIES EMPLOYEE COMMUNITY FUND (ACECF), FORMERLY THE PHILIP MORRIS EMPLOYEE COMMUNITY FUND (PMECF) WAS ESTABLISHED BY PHILIP MORRIS USA, AN OPERATING COMPANY OF ALTRIA GROUP, IN 2000 BECAUSE EMPLOYEES WANTED TO BE MORE ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN HELPING LOCAL COMMUNITIES. EMPLOYEES CONTRIBUTED TO THE FUND AND EMPLOYEES WERE ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN REVIEWING PROPOSALS FROM NON-PROFITS AND SELECTING ORGANIZATIONS TO BE FUNDED. ALTRIA CONTRIBUTES TO THE FUND AND PAYS ALL OPERATING EXPENSES OF THE FUND. THE EMPLOYEE GRANT MAKING COMMITTEES DISTRIBUTED TO THE COMMUNITY ALL DOLLARS THAT WERE CONTRIBUTED TO THE FUND. (CONTINUED ON SCH. O)GRANTS AWARDED:YEAR AWARDED RICHMOND # GRANTS CABARRUS # GRANTS2001 OVER $2.5 MILLION 96 422002 OVER $3.0 MILLION 108 502003 OVER $3.2 MILLION 99 382004 OVER $3.4 MILLION 84 372005 OVER $4.0 MILLION 93 442006 OVER $3.6 MILLION 72 302007 OVER $3.7 MILLION 77 302008 OVER $3.3 MILLION 72 312009 OVER $2.7 MILLION 90 312010 OVER $2.3 MILLION 91 PLANT CLOSED IN 09EVERY OTHER YEAR, THE FUND CONDUCTS A SURVEY OF APPROXIMATELY 5,000 EMPLOYEES TO IDENTIFY THE AREAS OF COMMUNITY NEED THE FUND SHOULD SUPPORT. IN 2008 (FOR THE 2009 AND 2010 GRANT MAKING CYCLE), EMPLOYEES SELECTED THE FOCUS AREAS LISTED BELOW IN TABLE 1 FOR RICHMOND. TABLE 1 - RICHMOND FOCUS AREA $ AWARDED # OF GRANTS % OF TOTAL DOMESTIC VIOLENCE $216,843 9 9.4%EMERGENCY SERVICES $164,201 8 7.1%HOMELESSNESS $292,877 11 12.7%HUNGER RELIEF $395,133 13 17.1%SENIOR SERVICES $417,000 18 18.1%(INCLUDING ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES)YOUTH SERVICES $821,851 32 35.6%(INCLUDING YOUTH WITH DISABILITIES)

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION REPORTS THE FOLLOWING IN ITS AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS REGARDING UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS: "THE FUND HAS DETERMINED THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS OR OBLIGATIONS AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2010."

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS IN THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: A REQUEST FOR A FINAL GRANT REPORT IS MAILED TO GRANT RECIPIENTS REQUESTING THE STATUS OF THE PROGRAM AND THE RESULTS OF GRANT EXPENDITURES. FUTURE PROPOSALS/REQUESTS ARE NOT CONSIDERED IF THE GRANT REPORT IS NOT FULLY COMPLETED AND SUBMITTED BY THE DUE DATE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A COPY IS EMAILED TO EACH OF THE BOARD MEMBERS. THE TREASURER AND ASSISTANT TREASURER REVIEW THE 990 INDEPENDENTLY. THE CHAIRPERSON THEN REVIEWS THE 990, GENERALLY WITH THE PREPARER PRESENT.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: UPON BECOMING A DIRECTOR, OFFICER OR A MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE TO WHICH THE BOARD HAS DELEGATED POWERS AND EACH YEAR THEREAFTER, AN INDIVIDUAL SHALL BECOME AN INSIDER AND SHALL COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DECLARATION FORM PROVIDING (I) THE NAME(S) OF ANY ENTITY IN WHICH THE INSIDER OR THE INSIDERS FAMILY HAS A SIGNIFICANT OWNERSHIP OR INVESTMENT INTEREST, OR WITH WHICH THE INSIDER OR THE INSIDERS FAMILY HAS A RELATIONSHIP AS A DIRECTOR, OFFICER, STAFF MEMBER, COMMITTEE MEMBER OR CONSULTANT, AND (II) THE NAME(S) OF ANY PERSON WITH WHOM THE INSIDER OR THE INSIDERS FAMILY HAS A COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT. THE INSIDER SHALL ALSO SIGN A STATEMENT AFFIRMING THAT HE OR SHE: A. HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THIS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, B. HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY, C. HAS AGREED TO COMPLY, AND, IF PART OF AN ANNUAL CERTIFICATION, HAS PREVIOUSLY COMPLIED, WITH THE POLICY, AND D. UNDERSTANDS THAT THE CORPORATION IS A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION AND THAT, IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS FEDERAL TAX EXEMPTION AND PRESERVE THE CORPORATION'S VALUABLE REPUTATION, THE CORPORATION MUST ENGAGE PRIMARILY IN ACTIVITIES THAT ACCOMPLISH ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. TO ENSURE THAT THE CORPORATION OPERATES IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH ITS CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES, AND DOES NOT ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES THAT COULD JEOPARDIZE ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS, THE BOARD OR A COMMITTEE APPOINTED BY THE BOARD SHALL CONDUCT AN ANNUAL REVIEW THAT SHALL INCLUDE, AT A MINIMUM, FINDINGS ON THE FOLLOWING SUBJECTS: A. WHETHER THE CORPORATION'S COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS AND BENEFITS, IF ANY, ARE THE RESULT OF ARMS LENGTH BARGAINING AND, BASED ON COMPETENT SURVEY INFORMATION, ARE REASONABLE. B. WHETHER PARTNERSHIPS, JOINT VENTURES, AND ARRANGEMENTS WITH MANAGEMENT ORGANIZATIONS IN WHICH THE CORPORATION PARTICIPATES, IF ANY, CONFORM TO THE CORPORATIONS WRITTEN POLICIES, ARE PROPERLY RECORDED, REFLECT REASONABLE INVESTMENT CRITERIA OR PAYMENTS FOR GOODS AND SERVICES, FURTHER THE CORPORATIONS EXEMPT PURPOSES AND DO NOT RESULT IN PRIVATE INUREMENT, IMPERMISSIBLE PRIVATE BENEFIT OR AN EXCESS BENEFIT TRANSACTION UNDER THE CODE.
PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15 A AND B ARE ANSWERED NO BECAUSE THERE ARE NO EMPLOYEES AND NO COMPENSATION TO SET BY THE ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 IS AVAILABLE VIA GUIDESTAR AND ALL OTHER DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THERE WERE NO CHANGES TO THIS PROCESS DURING 2010.
